document.docAuthor: Cruz, Paulo Vilela, Salles, Frederico Falcão & Hamada, Neusa
document.masterDocTitle: Contribution to the taxonomy of Paracloeode s Day 1955 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from South America

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Contribution to the taxonomy of Paracloeode s Day 1955 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from South America

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paracloeodes binodulus
Lugo-Ortiz & McCafferty 1996 : 163
;
Domínguez et al. 2006
: 170
;
Nieto & Salles 2006 : 9
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Male Imago. Body 3.23 mm ; forewing 2.93 mm (n=2). Head brown. Turbinate portion of compound eyes brown. Scape, pedicel and flagellum light brown. Dorsal portion of turbinate eyes slightly oval ( Fig. 6G ); length 1.1× width; stalk height 4.0× height of dorsal portion. Thorax brown, with one pair of black marks. Anteronotal and metascutellar protuberance rounded. Legs whitish. Forewings ( Fig. 6J ) with light brown veins; stigmatic area opaque, with 5–7 cross veins reaching subcostal vein; marginal intercalary veins paired, absent between ICuA1 and A; length of each intercalary vein 0.5–0.6× distance between adjacent longitudinal veins; length of forewing about 2.5× width. Hind wing absent. Abdomen with terga I–VI white, VII–X brown; tracheation black. Sternum I with brown pigmentation over surface, sterna II–VII with pair of sigilla brownish, segment V with two brown marks laterally. Caudal filaments lost. Genitalia ( Figs 6K–6N ) with forceps segment I and basal third of segment II light brown. Forceps segment I cylindrical; 0.5× length of segment II; distance between base of forceps 0.5× distance between lateral margins of forceps. Forceps segment III 0.3× length of segment II. Posterior margin of styliger plate convex, with pointed or rounded spine ( Figs 6K–6N ) medially (red arrow); without protuberance projected ventrally.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6.
Paracloeodes binodulus .
A. dorsal view of male nymph; B. ventral view of male nymph; C. dorsal view of female nymph; D. ventral view of female nymph; E. dorsal view of frons, black arrow indicates concave frons; F. dorsolateral view of head and thorax of nymph, yellow arrow indicates tubercles on thorax; G. dorsal view of male imago; H. ventral view of male imago; I. lateral view of male imago; J. forewing of male imago; K. ventral view of genitalia, red arrow indicates spine; L. lateral view of male imago genitalia, red arrow indicates spine; M. ventral view of genitalia, red arrow indicates spine; N. lateral view of genitalia, red arrow indicates spine.

FIGURE 7.
Paracloeodes binodulus .
Nymph. A. antenna; B. foreleg posterior surface; C. foreleg anterior surface; D. detail of dorsal margin setae in two views; E. cercus; F. paracercus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. The male imago of
P. binodulus
can be differentiated from other male imagoes of the genus by the following combination of characteristics: abdominal sterna II–VII with pair of sigilla brownish, abdominal sternum V with two brown marks laterally (
Figs 6G– 6I
) and styliger plate with pointed spine.

Material examined.
One nymph on slides ( holotype ), BRAZIL , Pará state, Rio Tapajóz , Pindobal ,
20.vi.1946
, H. sioli col., PERC . One nymph, BRAZIL , Amazonas state, Manaus, BR 174, Km 18.5,
22.i.2009
, 02°49’1.5’’ S / 60°02’7.5’’ W , P.V. Cruz col.
, INPA.
